title: Movie logo
author: woieblikk

comments.content:
Peignot Demi, with a bit of customization (addition of a crossbar, altering of the top curve) on the G:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/peignot/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132109/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/peignot/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/peignot/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132109im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Peignot_5935.png)

The rest of the type is Ronda:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/ronda/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132109/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/ronda/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/ronda/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132109im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Ronda_6541.png)
The main title is actually set in a knock-off of Peignot, to which I will not link (other differences include wider |p|h| and modified |k|).

Thanks for the correction, Riccardo.

There are actually three differently named typefaces that match the logo (Penultimate, Monterey FLF, and Metropol 95), but since they are obviously knock-offs of Peignot, I’m glad they didn’t show up in my initial search.
I found just two (one of which has another similar, yet different, name to one of your findings).
